intro: Jasminum flexile var. travancorense, commonly known as the Travancore jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, characterized by its fragrant, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are opposite and have a smooth texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. The flowers bloom in clusters and emit a strong, sweet aroma, making it a popular ornamental plant.
